intro: Cynoglossum brassicifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has a compact, low-growing habit. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Cynoglossum brassicifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
